name: Spectral Filtering (Resonance Selectivity)
description: The Swarm acts as a bank of coupled oscillators that can selectively resonate with a target frequency embedded in high-amplitude noise, effectively filtering the signal. This mechanism provides a physical basis for 'Attention' in the Pilot.
hypothesis: If agents are tuned to a target frequency and coupled to a noisy signal via Phase Response Curve (PRC) injection, they will phase-lock to the signal component and reject uncorrelated noise, increasing SNR.
implications: The Pilot can 'attend' to specific reality signals by tuning the swarm's natural frequency.
Noise tolerance is an emergent property of collective resonance.
Provides a mechanism for 'Cognitive Filtering' without digital logic.
